items.title: chore: 6.0.0-beta.1 w/ changelog
fix(badge): AoT and server-side rendering errors
items.body:
* Adds the badge component to the kitchen sink checks.
* Fixes an AoT error due to a reference to a private property in the `host` binding.
* Fixes a server-side rendering error due to a usage of `requestAnimationFrame`.

items.title: docs(select): Change select's openedChange output comment
items.body:
Currently, the docs says the `openedChange` emits when the panel has been opened. It also emits when it has been closed though.

Related to #9928, specifically https://github.com/angular/material2/issues/9928#issuecomment-365395601.

items.title: fix(button): inconsistent overflow value between browsers
items.body: By default most browsers will set the button overflow to `visible`, however it's `hidden` on IE. This is particularly visible on buttons with badges. These changes add a default value so the buttons are consistent between browsers.

items.title: feat(typography): add letter-spacing configuration to typography config
build: enforce that deprecated APIs have a deletion target
items.body: Follow-up from #9881. Ensures that anything marked with `@deprecated` also has a `@deletion-target`.

items.title: When using min&max in the datepicker, show year and multi-year view only if its needed.
items.body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: Proposal for enhancement of datepicker #### What is the expected behavior? When using `minDate` and `maxDate`, optionally display the `year` or `multi-year` views if there is only one choice to be selected. #### What is the current behavior? The `Year` and `multi-year` views are displayed even though there is only one option to be selected. https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-8oy79a #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
StackBlitz starter: https://goo.gl/wwnhMV
#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior? With the existing behavior, the users have to click multiple times just to learn the there are no more options to be selected from, which is a bit confusing. #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? 5.2.0 #### Is there anything else we should know? No.

items.title: chore: fix e2e axe failure
items.body: Fixes the e2e setup failing due to an error being thrown by the Axe plugin that was caused by us having two main landmarks.

items.title: Select component on a side drawer - escape key closes the drawer
items.body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug?

#### What is the expected behavior?
When the select is open on a temporary side drawer, the escape key should close the select list, but not the side drawer.

#### What is the current behavior?
When the select is open on a temporary side drawer, the escape key will close the drawer as well as the select list.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-dttmuf
1. Open the drawer using the button
2. Open the Select.
3. Press escape.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 5.2.4, Angular Material 5.2.1

items.title: Cannot build production version
items.body: #### Bug, feature request, or proposal: Bug #### What is the expected behavior? To be able to run `ng build --prod` #### What is the current behavior? Cannot build the production version of the app. #### What are the steps to reproduce? `npm run build --prod` This is the place where the bug comes from according to the terminal: ![screen shot 2018-02-13 at 5 26 32 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16253571/36161161-461fa6de-10e3-11e8-92fb-082bd6bb3bff.png) #### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior? To make it work in production. #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? `Angular Cli 1.6.2`, `Angular 5.2.0`, `Angular material 5.0.2.`, `chrome 64`, `osx 10.13.3`

items.title: chore(badge): fix bad import path in demo-app
Datatable samples have wrong alignment for the numbers
items.body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Wrong alignment for the numbers in the datatable samples.
Right alignment helps for comparison and calculation.

#### What is the expected behavior?
Right-aligned numeric columns
Left-aligned text columns

#### What is the current behavior?
left-aligned numeric columns
Left-aligned text columns

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://material.io/guidelines/components/data-tables.html#data-tables-structure

items.title: Docs for inputs selectable of MatChip and selectable of MatChipList are reverse
items.body:
The documentation of the input 'selectable' is the wrong way round with MatChip and MatChipList:

**MatChipList**
> Whether or not this chip is selectable. When a chip is not selectable, its selected state is always ignored.

**MatChip**
> Whether or not the chips are selectable. When a chip is not selectable, changes to it's selected state are always ignored.

https://material.angular.io/components/chips/api

items.title: <mat-checkbox> class not updating to ng-invalid
items.body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: The first time the component loads , the class is ng-invalid , if i check and uncheck the checkbox. The class does not update to ng-invalid. I am using the reactive form. I have set the Validators.required for this componenet #### What is the expected behavior? Class should update to ng-invalid #### What is the current behavior? Class is ng-valid , even though it should be ng-invalid #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
StackBlitz starter: https://goo.gl/wwnhMV
#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior? #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? "@angular/material": "^5.2.0" #### Is there anything else we should know?

items.title: Tooltip doesn't always hide when mouse leaves trigger element if trigger element is moved by an animation
items.body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:

Sometimes a tooltip will not disappear when the mouse leaves the trigger element if there are animations and delays involved elsewhere in the component.

#### What is the expected behavior?

The tooltip should always hide when the host element is not hovered.

#### What is the current behavior?

The tooltip will sometimes get "stuck".

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

This is the closest I can come to reproducing the issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-scrjcu?file=app/app.component.ts

Try clicking around to reproduce the issue as seen in this gif: https://gfycat.com/AdorableMiserableGrison

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?

Bug

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

Latest Stackblitz template, Chrome 64.0.3282.140 64 bit, Windows 10

#### Is there anything else we should know?

Could be a browser issue.

I would guess that the issue is related to a layout change that occurs while the trigger element is hovered - perhaps this causes no `mouseleave` event to be emitted when the cursor is then moved off the element or something similar.

items.title: Expansion-Panel with multiple levels of nesting
items.body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Feature request! 

#### What is the expected behavior?
It is necessary to rework the component Expansion-Panel or make another component with which you could build a hierarchy. That is, when expanding the first line, others should open with the same behavior - or the opened lines can also be expanded or contain static text.

#### What is the current behavior?
When you try to insert Expansion-Panel in Expansion-Panel now it does not work properly - the nested opens not equal to the outer (indents appear).

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
StackBlitz starter: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-kfjnu3


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
It is necessary to use the menu in the form of a hierarchy in the project - it is important to know the level of nesting!

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
this is not a bug

#### Is there anything else we should know?
no

items.title: 6.0.0-beta-0 should be 6.0.0-beta.0?
items.body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: Latest version is 6.0.0-beta-0 but to be consistent should it be 6.0.0-beta.0? #### What is the expected behavior? Version should be 6.0.0-beta.0 #### What is the current behavior? Version is be 6.0.0-beta-0 #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
StackBlitz starter: https://goo.gl/wwnhMV
#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior? #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? #### Is there anything else we should know?

items.title: build: publish artifacts based on branch
items.body:
Build artifacts will be published differently for different branches. For example, commits in `master` will be published on the `master` branch on the `*-builds` repository. `5.2.x` commits will be published on the `5.2.x` branch on the `*-builds` repository.

Tags on the build repositories will be explicit to indicate from what branch they come. The version placeholders (in the build output) will be similar as before, and won't contain any information about the branch. e.g. `5.2.x-5.2.1-43s435s` will look bad.

items.title: [MatTable, MatSort] Please add functionality to make multi sort possible
items.body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Feature request

#### What is the expected behavior?
It should be possible, that I can have an option to have multi sorting in a MatTable. So when I click on one column, I can sort, when I click on a second column, it should add this as a potential sorting.

#### What is the current behavior?
I can only sort for one column. After I click on a second one, it clears the one before.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
That I can use a multiple sort to refine a filter.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?


#### Is there anything else we should know?
It should be an option like matSortDisableClear.

items.title: build: enforce consistent version names
items.body:
* Ensures that versions are following a consistent format before publishing. e.g. versions like `6.0.0-beta-0` is not valid, because the last dash should be actually a dot.

Closes #9910.

items.title: Disabled input cuts off lowercase descenders
items.body:
Line height needs setting on disabled input fields, to prevent descender of lowercase words being cut off.

<input matInput placeholder="Name" value="the bottom of the g will be cut off" disabled>

Only visible in Google Chrome Version 64.0.3282.140 (64-bit). No issues when testing in Edge.

items.title: <mat-menu> content is active even if not opened
items.body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: Bug #### What is the expected behavior? So long as the menu is not opened I would expect the mat-menu content to not be active (similar to *ngIf="false" directive). #### What is the current behavior? **Even if ng-template matMenuContent is used** after the menu was opened once and the menu is currently not opened, mat-menu content seems to be active i.e. the components therein seem to be rendered as far as Angular is concerned according to e.g. property getter breakpoints. #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-9dp31o
Couldn't use ng-template matMenuContent here, but even with it in the newer version after opening and closing once content stays active. #### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior? Motivation is reducing of unnecessary performance hits (in fact I found that out looking at the Chrome performance devtools). #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? Angular 5.2.0, Material 5.2.0, Windows, TS 2.5.3, Chrome. #### Is there anything else we should know?

items.title: Fix typo in markdown, documentation for card component
Wrong Caret Color
items.body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:

Caret color of input and textarea is not correct in all browsers and systems.

#### What is the expected behavior?

Caret color of input and textarea should behave the same in all browsers and systems.

#### What is the current behavior?

When one specifies the color of the `mat-form-field` and uses `matInput` directive, the placeholder and underline have the right color but the caret does not respect the color change in all browsers and systems.

Namely:

- Microsoft Edge, Windows 10 - caret keeps the default color
- Safari, Mac - caret keeps the default color
- Safari, iPad - caret has some strange blue color
- Safari, iPhone - caret has some strange blue color

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

Here is a Stackblitz with three inputs (in primary, accent, and warn colors) and three textareas (in primary, accent, and warn colors) . Click into the components and observe the caret color in above-mentioned browsers.

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-jmgqlb

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?

Caret should look the same on all browsers, devices, and operating systems.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

See above.

#### Is there anything else we should know?

No.

items.title: Selecting table display options - MatPaginator does not work!
Mat-Tab-Group: Can't switch case based on selected tab outside of the tabs component
items.body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?
Use the `<mat-tab-group>` *selectedIndex* property elsewhere in the template via a `@ViewChild` reference.

#### What is the current behavior?
The template renders correctly, but it yields the `ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError: Expression has changed after it was checked.` exception on each tab click.

```
ng:///AppModule/AppComponent.ngfactory.js:30 ERROR Error: ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError: Expression has changed after it was checked. Previous value: 'ngSwitch: null'. Current value: 'ngSwitch: 1'.
    at viewDebugError (angular-material2-issue-w5inv7.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/@angular/core@5.2.4/bundles/core.umd.js:9808)
    at expressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError (angular-material2-issue-w5inv7.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/@angular/core@5.2.4/bundles/core.umd.js:9786)
    at checkBindingNoChanges (angular-material2-issue-w5inv7.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/@angular/core@5.2.4/bundles/core.umd.js:9953)
    at checkNoChangesNodeInline (angular-material2-issue-w5inv7.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/@angular/core@5.2.4/bundles/core.umd.js:14001)
    at checkNoChangesNode (angular-material2-issue-w5inv7.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/@angular/core@5.2.4/bundles/core.umd.js:13975)
    at debugCheckNoChangesNode (angular-material2-issue-w5inv7.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/@angular/core@5.2.4/bundles/core.umd.js:14804)
    at debugCheckDirectivesFn (angular-material2-issue-w5inv7.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/@angular/core@5.2.4/bundles/core.umd.js:14706)
    at Object.eval [as updateDirectives] (ng:///AppModule/AppComponent.ngfactory.js:83)
    at Object.debugUpdateDirectives [as updateDirectives] (angular-material2-issue-w5inv7.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/@angular/core@5.2.4/bundles/core.umd.js:14688)
    at checkNoChangesView (angular-material2-issue-w5inv7.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/@angular/core@5.2.4/bundles/core.umd.js:13813)
```

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Load this stackblitz and open the dev tools console: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-w5inv7?file=app%2Fapp.component.html

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
I'd like to be able to display some contextual text outside of the tabs component based on the selected tab.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

> Angular CLI: 1.6.7
> Node: 8.4.0
> OS: win32 x64
> Angular: 5.2.3
> ... common, compiler, core, router
> 
> @angular/animations: 5.2.1
> @angular/cdk: 5.1.0
> @angular/cli: 1.6.7
> @angular/compiler-cli: 5.2.1
> @angular/flex-layout: 2.0.0-beta.12
> @angular/forms: 5.2.1
> @angular/http: 5.2.1
> @angular/language-service: 5.2.1
> @angular/material: 5.1.0
> @angular/platform-browser-dynamic: 5.2.1
> @angular/platform-browser: 5.2.1
> @angular-devkit/build-optimizer: 0.0.42
> @angular-devkit/core: 0.0.29
> @angular-devkit/schematics: 0.0.52
> @ngtools/json-schema: 1.1.0
> @ngtools/webpack: 1.9.7
> @schematics/angular: 0.1.17
> @schematics/schematics: error
> typescript: 2.5.3
> webpack: 3.10.0

items.title: Prevent publishing versions that aren't in the right format
items.body:
We should block publishing any versions that do not conform to:
`^\d+\.\d+\.\d+(-(beta|rc)\.\d+)?$`

items.title: chore: add 6.0.0-beta-0 to changelog
fix(chips): form field label pointing to non-existing elements
items.body: Currently when a `mat-chip-list` is inside of a form field, the label of the form field has a `for` and `aria-owns` attributes that point to a non-existing element, because the `id` from the chip list isn't being used anywhere. These changes switch it to point to the chip list input, if it has any, otherwise it'll fall back to pointing to the chip list itself.

items.title: refactor(overlay): avoid circular type references
items.body:
Currently there is a circular type reference between `OverlayRef`, `PositionStrategy`/`ScrollStrategy` and `OverlayConfig` which can cause issues with some build tools. These changes introduce the `OverlayRefBase` type to avoid the circular reference.

Fixes #9491.
